page.title: 18Downing Street, Farnham.
page.content: {Downing Street}is one of Farnham's oldest streets and was , at one time, the main thoroughfare from north of Farnham to the south. Travellers crossed the{River Wey}near a sarcen stone marking its shallowest point. About 120 years ago South St. took over as the major route south. {Today}Downing St. is a bustling street lined with small shops almost all of which are privately owned. There are retailers of toys, fabrics, furniture, musical instruments, foodstuffs, cameras and clothing (most notably at Number Ten). Estate and travel agents abound and at the corner of Ivy Lane, on the former site of the Al Arak toothbrush factory, stands Farnham Conservative Club. A number of attractive ,ancient lanes lead off Downing St. in the direction of St.Andrews Parish Church.
